name: A review of Ooze Odyssey by Bobby Jack

itemReviewed.name: A review of Ooze Odyssey by Bobby Jack

words: a triumphant reinvention, bursting with innovation.
super mario bros wonder
i’ll let you in on an open secret: i adore 2d mario games.
super mario world
? of course, obviously.
new super mario bros
? yup, forget the haters, that series is still top-shelf.
super mario land
? sure. even the runt of this epic series is a fine game—i have a soft spot for it, too, given that it was my introduction to proper mario platformers.
nsmbud
, in particular, gets a much undeserved rap, in my book. still the eleventh-highest selling switch game, this fourth entry in the
new

series is oft derided for unoriginality, repeating a forumla established back in 2006. as a result, many critics have ironically repeated this claim of unoriginality, that there hasn't been a good mario game since
world
which is now, brace yourselves, 32 years old.
but
is great, with level design every bit as good as anything that came before, and plenty of everything that platformer fans want: challenging stages, diverse settings, secrets galore.
caption go here
so following up a set of games that is both fantastic and heavily-criticised is no mean feat. nintendo’s challenge: make it just as good as before, but change it up.

if you were paying attention to all the pre-release hype—and there was plenty of it in a year that featured mario in his own hollywood movie—you’ll be well aware that two big gimmicks are at the centre of nintendo’s strategy: wonder effects and elephant mario. the final product is, thankfully, far more nuanced and [] than that, but these aspects undoubdetly catch the eye right from the get-go.

wonder’s 1-1 features plenty of secrets, power-ups, and interesting enemies, but it’s the introduction of elephant mario and the wacky world of wonder seeds that really sets the scene for everything that's to come.

in truth, the elephant mario power-up is one of the more underwhelming innovations. don’t get me wrong: playing as an elephant/italian plumber-cross is a hilarious novelty at first, but it wears pretty thin pretty quickly. the powers it bestows are fairly run-of-the-mill, and the other two power-ups new to this incarnation offer far more []. what’s more, the cry of ”wowie-zowie” will soon stretch even the most patient of players. honestly, if i could turn off that particular sound effect, i probably would...
